column4: Anybody want to help me? I'm reinstalling Feisty from scratch after many problems, but I fear one may remain. Feisty doesn't recognize my Belkin Wireless G usb adapter, it worked fine in Edgy, but now it just doesnt work. Can someone give me a simple way to make it work?
did you need to do anything special in edgy for it to work?
no
and you're using network manager?
I just plugged it in, typed in my ESSID, and off it went
yeah, the default feisty one
when you insert the adapter, are there any warnings left in your log files?
in dmesg there are a few messages
which say?
and if im on tty1 it says something about registry busy
I posted it all on the ubuntu forums, I'll find the link
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=418857
is that the same driver that was used under Edgy? the rt73usb i mean
I assume, I didn't touch anything to do with drivers
check out this bug report, and se if it doesn't look familiar: https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.20/+bug/92931
similar, yes
check to see if you're running the mentioned kernel version. if so, you have two options: roll your own kernel, or wait for the fix (the report says a fix is committed, which is good news anyway)
roll my own kernel?
why not? it's one option. or wait for someone else to do it, as you like.
I suppose, thanks anyway
yup
